title: Trading under the Proof-of-Stake Protocol -- a Continuous-Time Control Approach. (arXiv:2207.12581v2 [econ.GN] UPDATED)
abstract: We develop a continuous-time control approach to optimal trading in a Proof-of-Stake (PoS) blockchain, formulated as a consumption-investment problem that aims to strike the optimal balance between a participant's (or agent's) utility from holding/trading stakes and utility from consumption. We present solutions via dynamic programming and the Hamilton-Jacobi-Bellman (HJB) equations. When the utility functions are linear or convex, we derive close-form solutions and show that the bang-bang strategy is optimal (i.e., always buy or sell at full capacity). Furthermore, we bring out the explicit connection between the rate of return in trading/holding stakes and the participant's risk-adjusted valuation of the stakes. translated_title: Proof-of-Stake协议下的交易——一种连续时间控制方法的研究
translated_abstract: 本文提出了一种连续时间控制方法，用于证明权益（Proof-of-Stake，PoS）区块链中的最优交易，将其构建为一个消费与投资的问题，目的是在参与者(或代理人)持有/交易股份与消费需求的效用之间取得最佳平衡。我们通过动态规划和Hamilton-Jacobi-Bellman(HJB)方程的解决方案，对此进行了阐述。当效用函数为线性或凸函数时，我们得出了闭合形式的解，并表明bang-bang策略是最优的（即总是以全部容量购买或出售）。此外，我们还揭示了交易/持有股份的回报率与参与者的风险调整估价之间的显式联系。特别地，我们展示了当参与者是风险中性或风险寻求型时，相应的风险调整估值为鞅或次鞅，最优策略必须是始终购买、始终出售或先买后卖，两者都是。
tldr: 本文提出了一种适用于Proof-of-Stake协议的连续时间控制方法，用于解决最优交易问题，并发现了交易/持有股份的回报率与风险调整估价之间的显式联系。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes a continuous-time control approach for optimal trading in a Proof-of-Stake blockchain and discovers an explicit connection between the rate of return in trading/holding stakes and the participant's risk-adjusted valuation of the stakes.
